Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Castration \Cas*tra"tion\, n. [L. castratio; cf. F. castration.] The act of castrating. [1913 Webster] ||

castration n 1: neutering a male animal by removing the testicles [syn: {emasculation}] 2: surgical removal of the testes or ovaries (usually to inhibit hormone secretion in cases of breast cancer in women or prostate cancer in men); "bilateral castration results in sterilization" 3: the deletion of objectionable parts from a literary work [syn: {expurgation}]
